result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua F Danielsen

records.addlTxt: Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant Joshua F Danielsen in court, in custody by video.  Attorney jeramiah maynard in court for Joshua F Danielsen.  Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin. Motion to modify bond by Defense. State objects to bond modification. Mother is willing to co-sign and is present in court. Bond modified, $10,000 surety with Wendy Schatz to co-sign. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.

BOND TO BE CO-SIGNED BY WENDY SCHATZ

BOND TO COVER 22CF354, 22CF394 & 22CF477
Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH E.L. OR RESIDENCE, V.W.S. dob 11-17-1980 OR RESIDENCE. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.
records.descr: Notice of motion and motion for discovery

records.addlTxt: Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt: Not guilty plea entered and trial reserved.
Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court

2:11 PM (64-06) Defendant Joshua F Danielsen appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jeramiah Maynard in court for Joshua F Danielsen.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin ADA Herrmann in court. 
Matter was scheduled for a preliminary hearing but the defendant wishes to waive his right to a preliminary hearing.  Response by Counsel and defendant to Court's questions.  Court finds defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives his right to a preliminary hearing and binds the defendant over. 
Arraignment held in open court.
Attorney Maynard acknowledged receipt of the Information, waived reading and plead not guilty to the charge on behalf of his client.
Speedy is reserved.

Motion to amend bond will be filed.

Adj. 2:14PM
Status conference scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Cash bond filed. Defendant refused to sign.

Defendant Joshua F Danielsen in court, in custody by video.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant given complaint; charges/penalties explained by the court. Rights given and preliminary hearing requested. Time period waived only to date selected. Minutes filed.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

BOND TO COVER 22GF920, 22CF394 & 22CF354

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH E.L. OR RESIDENCE, V.W.S. dob 11-17-1980 OR RESIDENCE. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Defendant Joshua F Danielsen in court, in custody by video. Vivien TenHaken appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Jeremiah Maynard for defendnant. $2500 cash bond set with same previous conditions. Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
